title: Welcome Dinner
description:
UC Davis and UCCSC Platinum Sponsor, Cisco, are pleased to host the UCCSC Monday night reception on the grounds of the [Robert Mondavi Institute](http://robertmondaviinstitute.ucdavis.edu/) Good Life Garden. The [Good Life Garden](http://www.goodlifegarden.ucdavis.edu/location) contains an ever-changing edible landscape, which features organic and sustainably grown vegetables, herbs and flowers.

On Monday, August 13, enjoy food and wine in a beautiful setting and mingle with your colleagues with a view to a vineyard.
rsvp:
[UCCSC registration](/schedule/2018-08-13/registration) will be available at the Monday night reception.

Parking is available at the [Gateway Structure](https://uccsc.ucdavis.edu/venue/gateway-parking-structure) across the street.

address.street: Old Davis Road Old Davis Road

title: Morning Yoga
description: A certified personal trainer will lead an outdoor morning yoga session. Participants will require a longer warm-up but will experience yoga the traditional way. Power Vinyasa Yoga is a combination of deep breathing and specifically sequenced sets of flowing yoga poses. It builds strength, increases endurance, releases tension, and creates more flexibility in the entire body.

title: Pre-Conference Meeting: UC Drupal Community of Practice
description:
The UC Drupal Collaboration continues to gain momentum across the UC System. Drupal is the primary web publishing platform for the vast majority of UC campuses. In this meeting, we will come together to discuss the [UC-Wide SiteFarm platform](/sessions/meet-sitefarm-university-californias-drupal-8-collaboration) and best practices for development, service delivery, documentation and training, and more.

If you use Drupal or otherwise in charge of web sites in the UC System, you're not gonna want to miss this!

#### Agenda:

*   Campus report 
*   Partnering with Campus Marketing/Communications 
*   Governance Check in
*   Install-fest, Q&A
rsvp: This pre-conference meeting is managed and organized by the Event Organizer, [Shawn DeArmond](https://uccsc.ucdavis.edu/attendees/shawn-dearmond).

organizer.name: Shawn DeArmond
organizer.bio:
Shawn is the Web Architect for Information and Educational Technology at UC Davis. He supervises the Web Development team, which offers custom web development services to campus units, as well as builds and maintains the SiteFarm web platform service.

Shawn has been a UC Davis employee since 1997 and cut his teeth at the School of Education. Now in IET, he drives a high-performing team implementing state-of-the-art web technology. They use highly evolved development methodologies and workflows including established version control strategies, code-review practices, and automated testing, builds, and deployment.

In addition his work at UC Davis, Shawn is a founding member of the UC Drupal Collaboration, along with UCLA and UC San Francisco, in an effort to save costs and create a community of practice of web development across the UC System. He has also organized the Higher Education Drupal Summit at the Bay Area Drupal Camp and DrupalCon since 2010.

title: Bowling at the Memorial Union
description:
Have some spare time? Check out the bowling alley at the Memorial Union on campus.

Six bowling lanes are reserved for UCCSC strikers. Wear your badge to check-in. Bowling shoes are required and will be provided, but bring your own socks please.
rsvp: Please be aware that the main entrance to the Memorial Union Games Area is currently blocked by construction. MU Games Area may still be accessed from the interior Memorial Union entrance. Follow the signs!

address.street: 523 Mrak Hall Drive 523 Mrak Hall Drive

title: Morning Walk through the Arboretum
description: Wake up and take a refreshing stroll through the UC Davis Arboretum, including a tour through California's living garden. This special tour will be led by [Warren Roberts](http://publicgarden.ucdavis.edu/in-the-news/uc-davis-arboretum-superintendent-emeritus-warren-roberts-featured-in-davis-enterprise), the Superintendent Emeritus of the Arboretum.

title: Lunch
description:
Fortify yourself for an afternoon of conference sessions and networking with your colleagues. Lunch sponsored by ePlus.

Seating is available in Moss Patio, Conference Center, and at the Mondavi Center.

title: Happy Hour Social Mixer
description: Get to know your community during the social mixer. This networking event is reserved for just that. All of us are here because we share things in common; take this opportunity to connect with others that share your interests. Mix and mingle, find your counterparts across the UC system, and enjoy!

title: Lunch
description:
Fortify yourself for an afternoon of conference sessions and networking with your colleagues. Lunch sponsored by [Dasher Technologies](/sponsor/dasher-technologies). Desserts sponsored by [ePlus](/sponsor/eplus).

Seating is available in Moss Patio, Conference Center, and at the Mondavi Center.

title: Birds of a Feather: All UC DocuSign Meet Up
description: DocuSign is being used in one way or another at all UC locations for electronic signature processes and forms automation. The UC-wide DocuSign special-interest-group continues to meet on monthly conference calls and via Slack. This forum will provide a face-to-face meet-up similar to the one held last year at UCCSC in San Diego. This forum will be open to any interested UCCSC attendees and will focus on sharing recent DocuSign activities, issues and directions from the reps each location. Please note there is a separate introductory session for DocuSign on the program where people who are not already active in the DocuSign SIG can learn more about the product and uses across UC.
rsvp: Contact Eric Taggart for more information: [etaggart@uci.edu](mailto:etaggart@uci.edu)

organizer.name: Eric Taggart
organizer.bio:
Associate Director, Enterprise Applications - UCI Office of Information Technology

I've been with UC since 1981 (UC Irvine Registrar's Office student programmer).  Co-created ASSIST (Articulation System Stimulating Interinstitutional Student Transfer) in 1984 as the lead developer, went on to serve as the Statewide Director for ASSIST from 1989 thru 2008 (under UCOP but located in Irvine).  UC Irvine Graduate Division IT Director in 2008, added Office of Research IT and other groups in subsequent years.  Now Associate Director, Enterprise Applications and overseeing Office of Research IT, HR IT, UCPath IT, Transportation & Distribution Services IT, Facilities Management IT, and Accounting/Financials/KFS IT (and some other miscellaneous).

venue.title: Helen Singer Suran Classroom - Gallagher Hall

title: Birds of a Feather: Documentation for a Product or Service
description: For departments/teams who provide a technical product or service for the campus (for example, a website platform or hosting service, a learning management system, document management, etc.), and who also provide documentation on how to use that product or service. Discussion could include what platforms are used for documentation, how often documentation is updated, how it's organized, and more. The goal of this discussion would be to share tips and ideas so that we can better serve our customers with our documentation.

organizer.name: Anna Gazdowicz
organizer.bio: Anna is a Web and Accessibility Specialist at UC Berkeley, in central IT, for the Web Platform Services team. Web Platform Services manages the Open Berkeley website platform (turnkey web platform solution for campus websites), helps campus departments adhere to the UC web accessibility policy (clinics, consultation, resources), and facilitates the campus relationship with Pantheon (external website hosting provider). She lives in Berkeley with her husband, son, and cat, and enjoys music, podcasts, running, riding her bike, cooking, and eating.

venue.title: Ali Abbaszadeh Lecture Hall - Gallagher Hall

title: Birds of a Feather: Business Continuity Planners (BCP) and IT Disaster Recovery (ITDR) Planners at UC
description: Meet with other Business Continuity Planners and IT Disaster Recovery Planners from UC campuses and Medical Centers to discuss trends, experiences, tools and more.
rsvp: Contact Louis Zeoli for more information or to suggest additional discussion topics: [louis.zeoli@ucop.edu](mailto:louis.zeoli@ucop.edu)

title: Breakfast
description: Energize yourself for a full day of sessions and activities. Wednesday morning breakfast, sponsored by Laserfiche, will be held in the Grand Foyer of Gallagher Hall. Seating is available in Moss Patio, Conference Center, and at the Mondavi Center.

title: Lunch and Learn: Women in Technology Panel - Creating Change
description:
_**Women in Technology is full. No more registrations accepted.**_

**Proctor:** [Vivian Khem](/attendees/vivian-khem)

Join a panel of UC IT women leaders for lunch and be part of a movement for positive change. Facilitated by UC Davis CIO Viji Murali, panel discussions will range from challenges women encounter, to combatting unconscious bias, to building self-confidence, to raising a voice for change. The panel will highlight recommendations for pragmatic actions to ensure UC supports and promotes women in IT. A working group will be formed to follow up on some of the ideas raised in this session and build an empowering work environment for UC women in IT. The panel will be followed by another WIT session: Empowering Women: From History to Practical Change.

Lunch will be provided in lobby outside the Vanderhoef Studio for up to 60 attendees as part of the session. The form provides an opportunity to submit questions for panelists in advance; submitters’ names will be kept anonymous. Confirmation of registration will be sent to attendees closer to the event.

title: Birds of a Feather: UC Health Profiles and Research Networking
description: In May 2018, five UC campuses joined a research networking system called UC Health Profiles, which shows researchers contact information, publications, grants and clinical trials - and connects researchers to their coauthors. UCSF has had the system for years and wants to meet up to discuss faculty engagement, product features and enhancements, and any other topics that might come up for techies supporting researchers with consumer-grade products.
rsvp: For more information, please contact Brian Turner: [brian.turner@ucsf.edu](mailto:brian.turner@ucsf.edu).

organizer.name: Brian Turner
organizer.bio:
http://profiles.ucsf.edu/brian.turner 
Brian is a member of the Research Technologies program of the Clinical & Translational Science Institute (CTSI) at UCSF. He is the product lead for UCSF Profiles, the UCSF Clinical Trials website, Application Review and Tracking (ART), UCSF Cores Search and some other products launched by CTSI.  Brian joined UCSF and CTSI in January, 2011. 
Brian has worked in software for over 20 years and been a product manager in medical software since 2003, including clinical support software, online personal health records, secure online doctor-patient communications and electronically delivered drug warnings. He has extensive experience bringing user-focused products to market. 
In 1997, he earned his MBA from the Haas School of Business at UC Berkeley with a focus in Technology Management and Product Development. Prior to studying business, Brian worked in space systems acquisition at the rank of Captain at Los Angeles Air Force Base. His undergraduate degree is in mechanical engineering from Washington University in St. Louis.

title: Lightning Talks! (Tuesday)
description:
Have something to share? Don't want to spend a lot of time doing it?

Lightning Talks are an opportunity to give a very short (5 minutes max!) presentation to the UC-wide tech community.

Here's how it will work at UCCSC 2018:

*   There will be a whiteboard in the registration/lunch area where you can sign up to deliver a talk at lunchtime on either day of the conference
*   Sign-up is first come, first served
*   Rooms will be assigned for lunchtime Lightning Talks on August 14 and 15
*   Show up on the day you signed up and give a great talk!

description:
Have something to share? Don't want to spend a lot of time doing it?

*   Show up on the day you signed up and give a great talk!

title: Pre-Conference Meeting: Project Management
description: Come and join your project management peers from across UC during the upcoming UCCSC in Davis. We have arranged for a short 1 hour session, hosted by Tom Andriola, UC System CIO, for us to network, socialize and advance the concept of creating a UC Project Management Community of Practice.

organizer.name: Tom Andriola
organizer.bio:
Tom Andriola joined the University of California in 2013 as vice president and chief information officer (CIO) for the system. He provides leadership across the university working closely with campus and healthcare leaders to explore opportunities for technology and innovation to enhance the UC mission of teaching, research, patient care, and public service.

Andriola brings over 25 years of experience as a global business and technology executive, having served as a business transformation leader for a multi-billion dollar enterprise, a global CIO with staff around the world, and the first employee of a brand-new business.  

Throughout his career Andriola has been a champion of change inside organizations, as well as a leader for innovation in the marketplace, having brought first-of-kind solutions to market and led the creation of several new businesses.

Andriola is active in higher education and healthcare associations and serves on several boards, including the California Tele-health Network, the Advisory Board for the Pacific Research Platform, the Corporation for Education Network Initiatives in California (CENIC), and the Risk Services Software Company. 

With his background in technology and innovation, Mr. Andriola maintains relationships with UCSD’s California Institute for Telecommunications and Information Technology, UCSF’s Institute for Computational Health Sciences, UCSF’s Center for Digital Health Innovation, the Berkeley Executive Education program through the UCB Haas School of Business, and the UC Health Center for Health Quality and Innovation. He is a sought-after speaker on a variety of technology topics in healthcare, higher education, and the changing CIO role. 

Andriola holds a bachelor’s degree from The George Washington University, a master's degree from the University of South Florida, and completed the Stanford Executive program.

address.street: One Shields Ave. One Shields Ave.

title: Endpoint Security
description: Discuss traditional and innovative approaches to securing endpoints. Share the technologies, practices, and policies in use or being developed.

organizer.name: Steve Pigg
organizer.bio: I've been blessed with an endless curiosity for how things work and a desire to make the world a better place. Working at UC Davis these last 14 years I've found many ways to engage my passions and achieve my goals. I'm currently the Executive Director of IT in the College of Engineering and have the pleasure of working with an awesome team.
